question: Refer to the figure <image 1>, which term refers to an illustration facing the title page that is intended to establish the tone and entice the reader to begin the story?
description: The image shows an open book titled "Just Peggy" by Margaret Stuart Lane, illustrated by M.D. Johnston. The left page features a colorful illustration of two children running in a grassy field with a dog chasing them. The right page displays the title page with the book's title, author, illustrator, and publisher information. The publisher is Humphrey Milford Oxford University Press, located in London. The illustration on the left page is facing the title page on the right.
